name: Waikoloa Beach Marriott Resort & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel for our honeymoon-and so glad we did! From the moment we arrived until we left, we were treated like a king and queen! The Valet always greeted us each day with big smiles-and knew our names by day 2! The front desk and conceirge was so helpful! I loved the ladies at the Coffee shop each morning too! The hotel restaurant is delicious-but we did eat at various restaurants around the area. Sensei was to die for in Queens Marketplace! We were glad we rented a car though to get around the island....I do suggest that!
reviews.title: STAY HERE!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Spent three nights and four days. All the staff were friendly, always with a smile, and tried to meet every need and comfort. The location is just gorgeous but service is equally important and we got good service there the whole time. The rooms were very spacious and clean. The beds and pillows were very comfortable also. You get what you pay for so it was a expensive, especially the food-well worth it to have an awesome vacation.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very nice reasonably priced hotel in Waikoloa. We have stayed at the Hilton resort and it was just too large and expensive. This hotel is open and lovely with a beautiful pool area and beach. The pool area although large is always packed and if you need a little shade you better get there early. Rooms were very nice but the king bed was so close to the wall my husband had trouble getting out of bed without bumping into it. It is easy walking distance to the shops and restaurants at Queens Court and King's Court. Our latest visit there was for Valentine's Day and we will definitely go back again.
reviews.title: My Favorite in Waikoloa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: So this is the first time I ever to Hawaii and booked this through a Travel Website and it was supposedly pays for everything and when I got here I paid the $150.00 resort fee which I knew about but what I did not know about is the $75.00 room fee. When I asked about this they said oh its for anything you use in your room. IE; movies, internet, phone. Well I have a cell phone so I don't need to call anybody from their phone, movies I have them on my iTunes account, Internet just plain sucks. I have better service on Dial-Up then what they have here. They classify this as High-Speed Internet well I compared it to Verizon internet and Verizon won. Food is WAY overpriced and overcooked. I ordered a Prime Rim dinner and wanted it medium rare and it came out medium well when I asked about it the Cook came out and said they don't know how to cook it that way. WHAT? WHY? You are a cook right? I can probably go to the Subway or Arby's down the street and they would know how to cook. When I come back I am looking for another hotel this one needs a lot of work to be classified as a 4 star resort. I would consider this a 2.5 star rating
reviews.title: Expensive Food, No Internet, Hidden Fees

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this resort back in 2006, and returned again last month based on that experience. We just love this resort! First of all, the location is wonderful. If you want to eat off property, there are 3 great restaurants across the street (our favorite is Roy's). If you want to go shopping, there is a mini-Macy's, Tiffany, Tommy Bahama, and many other great shops and galleries, also right across the street. If you want to go golfing, the shuttle will take you straight from the hotel to two pretty excellent golf courses. Five more golf options within 6 miles, a couple of which are world class.
reviews.title: Wonderful Resort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We spent 7 nights at the Marriot and absolutely loved it !
reviews.title: Waikoloa Beach Marriot is no ka `oi!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff definitely exemplified the aloha spirit; overall a very friendly vibe and while we were there it was not crowded at all ...we esp. loved the walking paths through the fish pond & lava area.
reviews.title: Great value
Loved the Marriott!
reviews.text: The location is great for casual snorkelling with lots of honu (sea turtles), tropical fish, eels just off the hotel beach.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Aside from sea and sun on the beach or by the many pools, there's the nearby King's Shops, Queen's Marketplace for your shopping and eating needs.
reviews.title: Convenient to the beach and shopping

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: The hotel is a great jumping-off point for visits to places like Waimea, Mauna Kea, the Kailua-Kona & Kohala area (i.e. for a great little outing, head about 10 miles north and visit Pu'ukohola Heiau National Historic Site and see the reef sharks while you're there).
reviews.title: Heave on Earth...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013
reviews.text: Tiny rooms, box tv, no wifi in the room (even if you wanted to pay for it) and given 2 beds when we requested a king MONTHS earlier. Bathroom looked like a locker room complete with thin towels and mushy, soft walls and questionable cleanliness. Desk staff was snappy and surly. Asked for a cup of water at the pool and was told if I didnt have a cabana I couldnt have a plastic cup of water, only a snow cone cup of water. Never again. Much better value at Hilton (right next door) for same price.
reviews.title: Underwhelmed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: This is truly a peaceful oasis. Beautiful ocean views, wonderful restaurants, great pool, and a super-friendly staff. We thoroughly enjoyed our time at this hotel and teh many sights to see in the area.
reviews.title: A calming place...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I Used Priceline and got this hotel for under $100 a night end of Feb into March. Super easy drive from airport and has a couple good snorkel beaches real close. Restaurant is expensive, but its a resort. My wife and I are hostel and tenting people, so this resort is def in the high end for us, but it was awesome for my birthday and for extreme relaxation. Our room was very nice, dinners are great and views are unbeatable. Also like the fitness center. Good deal if you get the right price.
reviews.title: Easy and good price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel has great common areas, including a very nice pool area and public beach. Many other tourists access the public beach right by the Marriott's beach. The rooms are average and the overall look and feel of the hotel is average. The amenities created by God---beach, weather, nearby mountains, are sensational! Their Luau is excellent as well.
reviews.title: New Year's 2013--Good Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a 2 week stay at the Waikoloa Beach Marriott Hotel. Nothing special, I actually expected much more from a Marriott hotel. Our small room was clean enough, only had three cockroaches in 2 weeks! The hallway carpets were visibly dirty and bunching up and some walls and doors were all marked up with black marks. All it would have taken was some elbow grease to clean the white walls and doors to remove the marks. It would have looked so much better. My big concern was the cleanliness of the glasses used in the restaurant and at the bar. We watched the bartender cleaning the glasses as he talked to customers. All he did was rinse them out in one sink (it may have had some disinfectant in it I do not know) and then in clear water and then place them on a rack to dry. The drinks actually tasted funny to us.Then when we went for breakfast one morning, one water glass that our waitress brought had a red lipstick mark on it..., and my husbands juice glass had red marks on the edge as well. He totally would not even accept a new juice while my water was replaced. This from a Marriott hotel. The pool was nice, no complaints.Bed was very comfy. Coffee shop upstairs had great Kona coffee.The rest of the hotel looked nice on the surface, and the staff were also very nice. They definately need some work. Because of these cleanliness issues,we will not stay again.
reviews.title: Not so great....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here 4 nights recently. We really like this property. It's beautiful and the staff was nice. The pools are nice and were not crowded during our stay. The beach is really nice and nobody was out while we were there, so it felt like a private beach. You can hike along the beachfront past some beautiful houses to the Hilton property and the path continues on their property and you can gawk at their lagoons, dolphins, etc. The Marriott is a nice-sized property and has the former royal fishing ponds with lava rock. There's also a short walk nearby with petroglyphs. The Marriott is right across the street from the Kings Shops, which is a nice outdoor mall with shops and restaurants and a block away is the Queens Shops, so you have many options for dining, shopping without having to drive. Go to Sansei on Sun or Mon happy hour! While the $25/nt daily resort fee seems steep, we got a decent nightly rate so it balanced out. Resort fee includes free parking and wifi. There was a delicious-looking breakfast buffet for 21pp, but we didn't get around to trying it. They also offered to extend your checkout til 8pm for $99, which we did and so got to enjoy a full day of sightseeing without worrying about storing bags or showers. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Would stay here again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A few complaints about this resort, nothing major but annoying. First off we had a King sized bed in a room that was probably designed for a Queen bed. I was the lucky one who got to sleep on the wall side and I could literally reach out and very easily touch the wall without much effort when lying down. It was awkward getting in and out of the bed because of the close proximity of said wall. Secondly, we couldn't quite get the air conditioning cool enough. Thirdly, taking a HOT shower didn't happen once during our weeks stay.
reviews.title: Would Stay Here Again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did however like the resort property and the fact that the Infinity pool is open 24/7.
reviews.title: Great Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in January to beat the winter dull drums in Colorado. The property was clean and very well appointed. The staff was friendly and helpful. We got a room with a partial ocean view that looked out at the pool area and were lucky enough to get to watch the luau dancers from our balcony! The buffet dinner was nice, but very small for the price.-would suggest going into Kona to the King Kamehameha Hotel for theirs! The location was great- with the bay and we walked for miles across the lava to some secluded little areas to fish. Along our way we came upon numerous sea turtles out sunning themselves in the sand--at that was it--no one else! Our very idea of paradise!
reviews.title: Absolute Favorite Resort Ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had the opportunity to stay here a few years back. It is our favorite spot even now. No other vacation has compared to the one when we stayed at this resort. They even have medical facilities because I had the flu when I arrived and they took care of me.
reviews.title: If you like staying at the resort and never leaving this place is for you

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 7 nights at the hotel and enjoyed the location very much. The pool and beach area is fabulous. You can walk along the beach in either direction. To the south is the Lava Lava Beach club, a great spot for a cocktail and watching the sunset. Walking north 20 minutes takes you all along the beach front to the Hilton resort. We asked for a different room after the first night since our oceanview room had more view of the hotel roof than the ocean. The hotel staff offered to change our room to one that was more to what we were expecting, which we appreciated. We enjoyed a great stay at this resort. Close, in wlaking distance to the King's and Queen's markets for shopping and restaurants. Like other reviews, my negative comments would be the daily resort fee for "parking and internet", and the lack of wireless internet in the rooms. Wired internet was however available in the rooms, and wireless was available in the lounge and terrace areas....which is where everyone went with their mobile devices to access wireless internet.
reviews.title: Lovely beach location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013
reviews.text: Do not stay here! No wireless Internet in rooms. Only basic cable TV on a junky old box TV - no ability to buy movies. Walls are paper thin. Only 1 electrical outlet in rooms however there are 3 plates covering other outlets and this is after staff said they renovated. Restaurant is over priced. Their beach is rocky and windy. Seriously poor quality for a Marriott.
reviews.title: Horrible for a Marriott

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Intermediate price, very nice pool, wonderful staff who attended to everything needed. Close to many activities, great concierge staff. Room was very comfortable, bed moderately firm. Close to shopping activities, a very nice and somewhat challenging hike, Hawaiian petroglyphs, bike ride if you want, water activities, etc. Location on sunny side of Island very nice---don't get hung up on seeing not much but Lava en route there---very nice in resort area, and you want on this side of Island if you want sun. But you can get to lush greenery within an hour quite easily, and Volcano national park in about 2.5 hours.
reviews.title: Very nice location, very friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 12 nights at the Marriott Waikoloa beach resort on the Big Island at the end of January. This was the first time we've stayed at a hotel in Hawaii - have always booked oceanfront condos.We had a FANTASTIC room thanks to Nicole and Anne at the front desk. The management and front desk staff did everything they could to make us happy and place us in the best room possible where we had an exceptional front row view of the beach and ocean, and the quiet we wanted. We felt as though we were in an oceanfront condo because of the privacy, yet we returned from our activities every day to a clean room and linens. Mahalo to the staff on the 4th floor south oceanfront for all the aloha.
reviews.title: Thank you Marriott Waikoloa!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed cocktails every sunset on our private deck looking over the historic lava site and out to beach and ocean. What a dream! In addition to the first class treatment, we visited the open air restaurant a few times. The bartenders are great fun and really work to initiate conversation and keep an upbeat atmosphere going. We enjoyed very good dinners served by cheerful staff. The warm infinity pool is a real asset to this resort. I usually don't swim in a hotel pool because it's too chilly, but at this pool I was able to walk right in and swim for a long leisurely time... heavenly. We also enjoyed the tennis court and it has shade after 4:30.
reviews.title: Relaxing and beautiful but a few issues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Front desk staff was friendly and hotel property is beautiful!
reviews.title: Hotel grounds beautiful! Room mediocre, not clean!

likes.liked: — The beautiful A-Bay in front of the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I LOVED A-Bay! A big wonderful ocean water playground in front of the hotel where one can swim, snorkel, or kayak. We loved walking the beach where we saw tons of Sea Turtles basking in the sun and swimming in the ocean. One day we walked way past the hotel beach to another area in A-Bay and had the entire beach to ourselves. It was very peaceful and relaxing! The sunsets at A-Bay are amazing!
reviews.title: Big Island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was mediocre. Our bathroom floor had tons of hair on
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Kinda Empty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: it and obviously housekeeping skipped cleaning the floors from the previous guests. I ended up wiping all the icky hair off the floor so as not to step on it. The bathroom floors need serious updating as does the shower stall/bathtub. The shower area needs more light. I read online that the rooms were renovated, well, it looks like the only new thing in the bathroom is the vanity, which was decent. The room was nice, bed was comfortable and clean, but the desk, coffee table and dresser drawer was a little dusty and dirty. Needless to say I sanitized the place myself with disinfecting wipes. So sad to pay over $200 a night and have to clean stuff up yourself. I'm not the type of person to complain so I just didn't mention this to the hotel staff. I was happy the bed was clean or I would of freaked out!
reviews.title: Want to return to Waikoloa

likes.disliked: — How far away from Kona it is.

reviews.title: Great Service
reviews.text: Stayed with this hotel for couple of weeks in November 2007. The territory was very nice - one of the nicest we stayed so far. Room was quite big and recently renovated. On the arrival we got the room and unpacked. A day later there was a small flooding from the nearby ice machine. Because of humidity it started to smell and we requested another room. Because we were having our honeymoon we got a free upgrade to the suite (NB – we kindly requested about upgrade availability - it was not offered. That was very nice and kind. We had two small fridges but neither of them did work well.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at the Marriott before moving over to the Hilton for the second part of our stay. We preferred the Marriott because of its smaller scale, more up-to-date rooms, warmer pool, and beach access. The public areas of the hotel are "contemporary Hawaii" which seemed a bit undefined to us. Our room (with a partial ocean view, overlooking the pool) was clean, comfortable and well designed. The beds and pillows were comfortable. The balcony had plexiglass instead of railings which made the view sitting down nicer. The restaurant (Hawaii Calls) was well priced (for the area) and the food and drinks were good. The breakfast buffet was not particularly inspired, but was better than average. The pool area was nicely designed and the beach is terrific. The Kings and Queens shops are nearby which have additional restaurant choices without having to drive too far.
reviews.title: Great Beach, Updated Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We booked this vacation for our extended family ages 11 to 90 and everyone had a wonderful time! The staff is very friendly and the service was excellent. We enjoyed the beach and pool. We really liked the nearby Kings Shops and Queen's Marketplace for our picnic lunches and other shopping. This was a great starting point for our exploration of the Big Island.
reviews.title: Great family vacation in Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a wonderful hotel the location was great and every staff member we met were much friendlier than any place we have been. We would go back and my only beef was the constant cigarette smoke. The hotel is actually a nonsmoking facility which makes the fact that we choked from cigarette smoke day and night a big disappointment. What happens at this hotel is that MANY people smoke on their balconies even though they are included in the nonsmoking area. The reason it is an issue here is that the balconies are in very close proximity and are small in about 3/4 of the hotels rooms. If you do not mind going to Hawaii and keeping you balcony doors closed all of the time it would be paradise. The hotel staff and manager were very nice and concerned however they have very poor in room explanation of their smoking policy so I think the smokers actually think you can smoke on the balconies,as this was not just one person, at least 5 people around us. We woke up as early as 7am to a room filled with cigarette smoke. This hotel would be better off with smoking sections if it does not have the policy either better defined or enforced. For a smoker I would say this hotel is perfect or for a nonsmoker who doesn't mind closing the balcony doors it is otherwise paradise
reviews.title: wonderful but too bad about the smoke

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel gave us great service from the start---from extra hangers, an extra robe, to internet service help. The concierge desk was very helpful and accommodating in our several dealings with them also. We spent eight days here, and we highly recommend the hotel and hope to come again.
reviews.title: Great service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Maybe a notch below the Mauna Kea, Hapuna, or Mauna Lani in opulent decor and luxury flourishes, but still very nice at about half the price.
reviews.title: A good choice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Of course Hawaii is amazing. But this hotel showed us exactly how amazing it could be! The open hotel lobby, outdoor bars, beautiful pools and jacuzzis, authentic amazing luau, shockingly clean grounds and rooms, the beach access, boardwalk, tiki lighting, sunset views, rentals and more... I couldn't have asked for more!!
reviews.title: The time of our lives!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took a chance on the Marriott after reading the reviews………….and………..WE LOVED IT.
reviews.title: Very Relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I could find little things to nitpick, you could at any resort, over all this place is GREAT.
reviews.title: Hotel needs some TLC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012
reviews.text: We traveled at the end of the Easter break 2012 and it was quite at the Marriott, very relaxing.
reviews.title: Great rooms really expensive food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It has a great location, one of the few with a real beach and the view from our room……….beautiful.
reviews.title: A pleasant stay at a worn out hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This place is a slice of heaven. Everything from the garden-view room to the haupias at the bar to the lunch served pool-side was wonderful! I loved the free luau lessons with Auntie Lei. I enjoyed the two free snorkeling sets for half a day in the bay. The four pools, two hot tubs, and natural ponds were great. The staff was very friendly. The onsite luau was excellent. As if all of this weren't enough, their open air restaurant has a couple of cats that come through. I love cats. This was just the icing on a very large and yummy coconut cake. The gift shop is even reasonably priced. The breakfast bar was yummy. It was just a great experience!
reviews.title: Loved it!

likes.liked: — The haupias at the open air bar
likes.disliked: — The breakfast bar staff can be a little terse.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Date Stayed: May 17-24, 2008
reviews.title: Wonderful Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reviewer: Tupelo, MS
reviews.title: Nice hotel but pricey

likes.disliked: — extra resort fees, birds trying to eat my breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I along with our three year old daughter recently enjoyed a week at the Waikoloa Marriott. We chose this property because of its beach. After arriving, we spent most of our time at the incredible pools. My daughter loved the shallow sand bottom pool as did I, she could play and I could enjoy some sun time.
reviews.title: Corporate sterile

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room and view was beautiful. As everyone says the bed was incredible. One you wish would fit in your suitcase. The room was well designed. There was a shelf under the vanity for your personal items. The cabinet that housed the fridge had upper shelves to store your snacks so your room was not cluttered. The safe was large enough to hold our lap top, cameras and valuables.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Hotel was at full capacity, so there were some issues but the staff dealt with each appropriately. Unable to check in to both rooms by 3 pm, so they hooked us up with breakfast passes for both days. The parking is inadequate when the hotel is full - self parking lot was full both nights, but we were given valet parking without extra charge.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay at Waikoloa Beach Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Ka'ahumanu Wing. Unusual layout - to get to the elevator, you take a long ramp down a half floor. One room had a nice pool view with adequate seating area and balcony; one room had a king bed, a sofa bed, view of Mauna Loa, small balcony and ample space. No, there's no WiFi in the guest rooms - but are you going to Hawaii to sit in a hotel room!? Go to the public areas and jump online - plenty of comfortable seating near the lobby level coffee shop.
reviews.title: Great hotel, nice bay and sea turtles

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast Buffet is pricey at $29, but if you partake - leave your diet at home!! Amazing selection to fill up on. You could probably skip lunch!
reviews.title: "Great hotel for everybody"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very fresh, almost business-feeling hotel. The property is small for a resort - not a lot of different areas to explore EXCEPT the Ancient Fish Ponds. My favorite landscaping feature - the way they integrated this beautiful, natural feature into the property is impressive. Take a moment to view the fish and eels, and walk all the way around to the canoe club (that's where most of the feral cats seem to come from). So interesting just after sunrise.
reviews.title: Mediocre at best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Kings' Shops are a quick walk across the street. I enjoyed the Farmers Market which was set up among the shops the day we left. Nice mix of vendors.
reviews.title: Big Island Marriott

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I travel a lot in the states for work and was on a honeymoon to Hawaii, coming from Waikiki Parc for 3 nights (reviewed) and then we went to Maui and UpCountry, and rented a home (Aloha Cottage-Bali Bunglelow) for a week.
reviews.title: Nice value and great property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Though resorts are not my style, as I prefer a beach cottage, and often head to Hamptons and Costa Rica, this Marriott as a loyal client for business in the states, is very nice, the property has everything you need, and shopping nearby is ideal.
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked (using points) a Garden View Corner room, its huge, they put us on top floor away from elevators, and its was ideal, the beds are like sleeping on a cloud, OMG its comfy.
reviews.title: Notable comfort, friendliness and luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were out everyday in a rental (jeep is the bomb) and didnt spend a lot of time here besides the pool in the morning.
reviews.title: One for the kids

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food looked so so, we ate out all meals. The Four Seasons for lunch is so good at same price, and Kona is a nice scene and option. We also ate up the road at resorts too.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic relaxing stay here. We opted for a garden view room which was very nice and had a lovely view out towards the volcanic scenery.
reviews.title: Relaxing stay with a beautiful setting !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First time at a Marriott resort and liked it. We had buffet breakfast which was always outstanding, fresh and the staff were always very attentive.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The infinity pool is gorgeous and the jacuzzis are great to relax in on an evening. The pool and jacuzzis are open 24 hours. The beach is also a must to laze the day away.
reviews.title: Marriott Waikoloa Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We like to workout when we are away ( so we can eat more !!) and the gym was more then adequate for our needs, always tidy and clean.
reviews.title: Great Resort on the Big Island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: There are offers on at the bar and restaurant during the week and weekends. Have to say staff don't broadcast this when you check in which is a little disappointing as the only other way you would find out about the offers is through a sign at the entrance to the restaurant and the Marriott newsletter for that week, which is just on reception.
reviews.title: wonderful, relaxing vacation hotel
Watch out for "hidden" charges
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, was charged the $25 resort fee, which included Internet. The internet service was terrible I had to use my own data vs. the hotels wifi, then I discovered a $20 extra fee to my debit card, and I'm having a hell of a time getting ahold of the accountant, apparently the're never available n they don't return calls, so check your credit card for extra charges:-(

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at the Marriott for three nights in April. Our family's experience was positive and negative with the resort.
reviews.title: Great pool area but housekeeping needs to improve

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positives:
reviews.title: Beautiful pool, beach, location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: - We really enjoyed the easy access to the hotel as self parking was close in.
reviews.title: Prime location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - The pool area was great. The heated infinity pool being wonderful to swim in during the day or night.
reviews.title: Great location, incredible time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: This resort has everything including activities, luau, beach, swimming pool, jacuzzi, tennis court, etc. The service is excellent and the room has a great quality. The resort is conveniently located in Waikoloa area, two minutes drive to two shopping areas in Waikoloa.Try to go to the beach adjunct to the resort. Good for swiming and snorkeling. There are many things that children can do within the resort.It takes about 20 minutes drive to down town Kona and less than 15 min drive to famous Hapuna Beach.
reviews.title: One of the best resort in the Big Island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This Marriott is BIG - conventions and weddings can be going on without impacting your stay - but the grounds alone make it worth the visit. All the best resort amenities (activities staff, pool with slide, infinity pool with spa, patio fine dining, daily specials, etc.) are situated in an area with historic, cultural significance. The resort is located on a small bay among old coastal lava fields and ancient fish ponds; they have incorporated the buildings into this landscape and make it both interesting and appealing with walkways, signage and beautiful plants and trees. The rooms are well appointed, with extremely comfortable bedding, ample towels and good quality toiletries; a safe and small refrigerator are standard. There is a complimentary shuttle that will take guests to a very nice shopping area just a few blocks from the resort - I saw many simply walking to get their Starbucks fix. There is just one annoyance - the self-parking! Although I have to say it was no worse than any other Hawaiian resort, the spaces were mostly for compacts, and many guests parked in such a way that even a compact could not fit in the adjoining spaces.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort on the Big Island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 4 months reading reviews in planning our trip to the Big Island. Picked the Waikola Beach Marriott for the beach. The hotel setting was more than expected. Great location, great views.Alas the rooms could use updating but they were clean and spacious and who goes to Hawaii to spend time in their room.Toured several other resorts this setting beat them all.Service and staff was friendly and efficient. Must mention Debbie at front desk made our check-in an enjoyable experience, Paul the Concierge gave us invaluable help in planning our activities But Rhell Yamando the towel hut attendant at the pool area made the greatest impression of all, friendly, intelligent and sincere service when you least expect it was a treat.
reviews.title: Money well spent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: Having spent bucco more $$ at the Fairmont, this hotel provides comparable amenities with a better value. Boasts an incredible infinity pool, a slide for kids, and a great beach to watch kite surgers take lessons and try their sport. As a Platinum Elite member, all amenities were provided (wi-fi, discounts on coffee, breakfast, spa, and cabanas) along with an ocean view. Nearby upscale shopping as well. Definitely one of Marriott's shining stars!! (Ie. San Mateo Marriott had 70's era furniture and charged $100 more per night).
reviews.title: Great view, pools, and value!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed here on 3 occasions and have enjoyed the room, service, the grounds, and the food each time.
reviews.title: Waikoloa Beach Marriott

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Vacationed at the Waikoloa Beach Marriott with my wife and 4 year old son for 10 days. Overall, our experience was satisfactory, but for the money, you are better off staying at other nearby properties.The pool area at the hotel was nice. We also enjoyed the common area lanai. We also found the customer service to be above average. On the other hand, our room was tiny. There was barely enough space for the 3 of us to move around. Our room wasn't as modern as we had expected and we were surprised with the 27" box style television - no LCD or flat screen. We'll definitely go back to the Big Island, but we won't stay at this resort again.
reviews.title: Nice Grounds, Disappointing Room
Nice mid size hotel
reviews.text: This hotel is average Marriott. Rooms were not too small, though as others have noted the balcony is not large. Bathroom is tiny. My ocean view had a sort of view as long as you lean over the banister, much to my disappointment. There is no wifi in room, only plug-in Internet, which is not useful on an IPad, iPhone or similar wireless device. As a Marriott Elite I was told that my Internet was free.... But since I only can do wireless, the only internet I could get was to sit in the lobby. This was a work-cation, so I won't stay here again as it made work unnecessarily difficult. I appreciated having a refrigerator in the room. Location of this hotel is very good. Across the street from the Kings and Queens shops (2 separate shopping areas). Staff was very helpful, but like everywhere in Hawaii, staff work on "island time". I also wish they would post notes about being quiet in the hallway outside rooms, as with many families, the evenings were pretty noisy. Valets were very helpful. Concierge is through Expedia, and truthfully the Internet was more helpful than the three different people I asked questions. None were answered but sitting in the lobby reading TripAdvisor posts answered questions.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I went to the Big Island on a babymoon trip. We first went to the Hilo side of the island for a couple days. Most, if not all of the hotels on that side were a little older and didn't have the resort-feel of the Kona-side hotels. That said, when we got to the Marriot after being in Hilo, we were overjoyed with the step-up in accommodations.
reviews.title: Fantastic Big Island Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: A couple things that we really liked about the hotel and timing of the trip. We went in September, right after the summer peak season. Fares were very reasonable, and the hotel seemed less than half full. There were nightly dinner and drink specials to keep the guests on the property. This is probably needed since it's the one hotel in the area that is right next to a shopping center with a Roy's and other restaurants.
reviews.title: Marriott in need of a remodel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The pool area was kept up nicely, and there was a smaller pool with slide for children. Although when we went in September, there weren't too many young kids around. A plus for couples. The beach area in front of the hotel was ok. We typically went to the Mauna Kea resort area in the morning to go snorkeling. That beach was supposed to be the best spot in the general area for snorkeling, and I did see a see turtle and a good variety of fish in the morning.
reviews.title: Great choice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let me start by saying overall, we had a very enjoyable trip to the Waikoloa Marriott Beach Resort. My wife and I left the kids behind and took a weeklong stay with just the two of us. Our arrival in to KOA Airport was interesting. The landscape was not what we expected, and the Hut style airport terminals were charming. We picked up our rental car and headed straight from the airport towards the the city of Kona to pickup some groceries before we headed to the resort. We were looking for Wal Mart, but after sitting in miserable Saturday afternoon traffic, we decided to run in to K Mart because that is what we came to first. Smart move, they had a modest selection of groceries and booze, but at reasonable prices. They also had good prices on souvenir items, beach items, anything you might need for a stay on the island. We then headed North towards the resort. The terrain on the drive up to the resort resembles some sort of weird martian landscape made from lava, but awesome in a way. About 35 minutes later we arrived at the resort. The entrance to the resort area is beautifully landscaped and exactly what you picture for Hawaii. We easily found the Marriott, and we parked the car in the circle drive where the Valet kept the keys while we checked in. We had to wait a few minutes to check in because one of the other guests had a problem with the pricing their travel agent had given for their stay(another reason I stay away from agents).
reviews.title: High Quality, As Expected
Very Pleased!
reviews.text: Once freed up the front desk staff was very warm and accomodating. They made us feel welcome from the git go. We were provided a complimentary ocean view upgrage because I was platinum using points for the stay. They also said that because I was platinum I had the choice to pay the $20 resort fee or just parking. I felt the resort fee was reasonable, as it includes self parking, internet, a one time coupon for 2 mai tais($20 value) , and 1/2 day snorkel rental for 2 every day. I felt having the internet was worthwhile, as we used it to look up things to do and to make dinner reservations. I have a sprint air card so theoretically I could have used that, but when I tried it the connection was slow. The hotel internet was faster than most hotels I stay at. Once checked in, we parked the car in the self parking lot a short distance away. Parking was not an issue the whole time we were there. The only issue we had with parking was that they had tons of parking in the valet lot that was always vacant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Room- The room was cozy. with king size bed, fridge, safe, tv. Nicely decorated and clean. Had a patio with a beautiful view of the grounds and you could see A' Bay. The temperature was comfortable, even though there was some direct sun in the evening. We did use the AC most of the time we were there, because it got a little toasty. The maid service was prompt, and they took care of the room well. They did nightly turn down service, but one night they got behind and came by at 9:30 which was a little invconvenient. The room was adequate size for 2 adulys, any more would have been cramped. We enjoyed sitting on the lanai each morning eating breakfast and drinking coffe.
reviews.title: Liked the Marriott Waikoloa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Resort Amenities- The grounds were beautifully maintained. The lobby area was beatiful, and often had a nice breeze blowing rthrough. There is a laundry room that is well maintained and clean, I recommend getting up early and starting a load to avoid the lines. The pools were awesome, clean and well maintained. The water was always cool and crisp. Enjoyed the jacuzzi a few times. There is even a water slide. The pool house staff were courteous and we never had trouble getting clean towels.
reviews.title: We Liked It, But...

likes.disliked: — Small rooms and finding roaches in our room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The restaurant and bar- Not really impressed with either. We ate a very overpriced resort meal of fresh Mahi which they way overcooker. The menu options for lunch and dinner were way too expensive for what you get. I have no problem with resort prices if they deliver product or food that is as high in quality as it is in price, but they did not deliver the quality food they should have for the price. The bar made good drinks, but they were pricey and there was limited and somewhat sporadic cocktail service poolside. Our solution to the meals and bar was this:
reviews.title: PERFECT Vacation!!!

likes.disliked: — That they wouldn't let me stay another week without paying! ;)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: The Marriott has the bones of an old lady but the face of a teenager...and it shows. In other words, it appears to be an old hotel that has had a significant face lift. Overall, it works. The hotel is contemporary, comfortable, open and airy. The rooms are well-sized, comfortable, and tastefully appointed. Our garden view room actually had a garden view and a good chunk of an ocean vista as well. The pools are nice, but the best feature of the hotel is that it actually has a sandy beach on a calm bay...no small feat on this lava-rock-strewn shore. It's also walking distance from many shops and restaurants, also a big plus on the Kona side of this island. Okay, now the bad stuff. There is only one restaurant and one bar. The food in the restaurant is over-priced and mediocre, the bar is fine. But with two shopping centers close by, including one with an excellent market full of hot-and-cold take-out food, the restaurant issue is no problem. The business office is horrible - it cost me $7 to print out a single page ($1 for printing and $6 for computer access). I have traveled all over the world and have never, ever encountered something like that. It is a blatant rip-off and the staff is unapologetic about it (to be fair, the business office is not run by the Marriott...but the fact that they have outsourced it to a bunch of con artists doesn't reflect well on the hotel). The conference facilities are great...but the catering at those events sucks. All that said, we would stay here again.
reviews.title: Good value, great beach, pleasant stay, but some drawbacks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009
reviews.text: Wonderful hotel with good food, great staff, and a great beach-front location. The Marriott is in the beautiful Waikoloa area but is not pretentious and overwhelming as its neighbor, Hilton. It's located right by two sets of shops (King and Queen shops) where you can grab an affordable bite to eat, and has a great beachfront on the bay that is a great place to snorkel and is not too crowded. The hotel is not huge but has a great lobby with many comfy chairs for chats or some leisurely reading. The pool area is enjoyable, perfect for both adults and children. The restaurant and bar area is comfortable and relaxing, but serves great food and drinks. The rooms are comfortable with a plush bed and great amenities.
reviews.title: Relaxing and beautiful place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for our 4yr. anniversary and we loved it. I had called room service 2 weeks before and wanted to have strawberries and wine in the room before we arrived. I talked to Karen and she was very helpful. All we wanted was set up so beautiful in the room. When we arrived it was 6am and check in is at 3pm. We asked Nick at the front desk if there was a room avaliable and he was very accomidating. We went to breakfast at the hotel and by the time we were done we had a room. The service was great the whole week and the hotel is close to spots to eat and shop. I enjoyed the pool area and was very happy they had seperate kids and adult pools. I would stay there again. I would recommed this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cannot say if we were fooled by our travel agent, but I really don't understand the price we paid for this hideous hotel. Everything there was totally disappointing: from the rudeness of the staff to the room size (are we hobbits??), from the price paid for the breakfast to the irrational concept of this hotel: in order to reach the hall from our room we had to walk for miles! Moreover, it is so far from every tourist attraction on the island that we had to move to another hotel on the other side of Big Island!!!!
reviews.title: the worst hotel we had in Hawaii

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do you want an advice if you plan to stay in waikoloa? Go to the Hilton, it is much better!!!!
reviews.title: Decent clean rooms - solid staff - great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Just perfect to have most of it from a beach holiday in Hawaii. Food was good. Nice private beach. There are couple of eateries..all served excellent food. Pools are good too....kids pool is a good place for kids to spend time and enjoy. Lovely view from hotel room. location is a bit odd. But very clam and quite, perfect escape gateway from a busy life.
reviews.title: Loved our stay...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: By far the best hotel I've stayed at thus far. It is truly a paradise on earth. The rooms are modern and clean, the hotel is marvelous, the service is hilariously good, the pools are picturesque and the beach, with sea turtles and coral reef for snorkling, is to die for. I have to add how incredible the air-condition in the rooms are as well – you don't even notice it's there.
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only cons would be:
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: bed is a tad to soft for my liking and you need a car to get around (as non-drivers we still managed to find loads of excursions that could pick us up straight from the hotel though – and many of the sea based activities can even be done within the resort itself. The expedia staff of the hotel is great).
reviews.title: Just what you'd expect from a resort Marriott

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wish we never had to leave this amazing place with all the wonderful people – full of aloha.
reviews.title: Very nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Front Office Manager at this property seems to be completely clueless on how to interact with guests and their immediate questions/problems.
reviews.title: Rude & Unaccommodating

likes.liked: — Friendliness of cleaning crews, parking attendants and access to beach
likes.disliked: — Bad Attitudes of Front Office Mgr and unwillingness to follow through with what was requested

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I would strongly suggest that if you make any requests (ie. double beds, connecting room, etc.) that you get it in writing and document the individuals name, date, time of your call, etc. We requested these very things months in advance and when we arrived we were told that these things were never requested and the front desk asked us repeatedly the name of the representative who assisted us with the initial reservation. I never dreamed that I would have had to document this - especially at a Marriott and why couldn't they find this information in their computer?? Don't they have employee ID's and log-on codes like the rest of the business world? I did have a print out of my request for the double beds which I had left at home and I pointed out that we were traveling with 2 young girls under the age of 12 - why would I have not specifically requested a connecting room? Does this make any sense to anyone?? As a result, we spent our family vacation in completely separate rooms, calling on the phone each time we needed something or wanted to interact.
reviews.title: Awesome trip to the Big Island!

likes.liked: — Location of the hotel and the beach.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The food at the restaurant downstairs was horrible. We only ate there one night and found that EVERYTHING was drizzled in teriyaki sauce - the chicken, the steak, the fish,.....Awful!!! There was no Hawaiian music playing in and around the resort - instead two people were hired to sing outdated 80's songs in the dark corner of the bar. We live in Southern California and have access to wonderful beach resorts - we don't need to go to Hawaii to find a beach - we go to Hawaii to find "Hawaii".
reviews.title: Just a so-so experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: In the end I complained via letter to Marriott and the General Manager of the property sent me a letter stating that my "comments were valid" and proceeded to reimburse me the $145.81 resort fee that we paid during our stay - which does cover the cost of the awful dinner but does nothing to make up for the fact that they couldn't get it right from the beginning and when I expressed all this to the Front Office Manager ("Andrade") he didn't even care to ask me what rooms we were in or how long we would be there. Absolutely a HUGE disappointment. At a time when the economy is not doing so great and Aloha Airlines has affected the amount of visitors arriving - one would think that customer service would be more of a priority - this Front Office Manager and his staff couldn't care less. I was handed my bill at check-out which exceeded $5000 and was never once asked if I had a pleasant stay, etc. Totally Unbelievable.
reviews.title: Mostly loved the Marriott Waikoloa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only redeeming quality about this resort is the access to the beach and the friendly cleaning crews and parking attendants we encountered during our stay. I would never stay at this resort again, neither would I recommend it to anyone else.
reviews.title: Very nice stay here!

likes.liked: — Beautiful room, hotel grounds, proximity to marketplace
likes.disliked: — Bathroom a bit dark, beach sand was rough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent two nights here in a deluxe comfortable room with beach/lagoon view. This place is quite large. The food was good but nothing to rave about. Breakfast at the coffee shop and at the buffet restaurant was very good, not cheap but it is to be expected in a place like Hawaii and in such a resort. The cafeteria style restaurant near the pool also had good options and the food was tasty. The main problem was with the quality of food that came when we ordered room service. Everything was under-seasoned but salty and seemed just randomly thrown together.
reviews.title: Large, pretty property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall this place is a great option when visiting the Big Island. There is plenty of room to get comfortable even during a busy vacation week, in the shade or in the sun. The lagoon which is fed with ocean water is wonderful with its turtles and fish. The dolphin pool is also quite entertaining even if you don't pay for the actual experience.
reviews.title: Laid back oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I enjoyed staying at the Marriott in Kona. It does feel like you are staying in a oasis due to it's volcanic surroundings. The hotel complex was nice but the rooms weren't overly large and bathroom facilities quite obscure.
reviews.title: B+

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The pool is the hub of this resort and is big enough to relax on your own without feeling like you're on top of one another. The hotel's restaurant was nice with ok service.
reviews.title: Nice but needs updating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you take a short walk along the beach to the Lava Lava restaurant it's brilliant. Excellent food and not overpriced. The ambiance is fantastic and service is great.
reviews.title: Our Vacation

aka: Waikoloa Beach Marriott Resort And Spa
description: Guests seeking relaxation and rejuvenation will find it all at the luxurious Waikoloa Beach Marriott Resort & Spa, located on a sandy, swimmable beach along the sunny Kohala Coast of Hawaii’s Big Island. This beachfront resort offers contemporary elegant guestrooms featuring private lanais, oceanview dining, heated infinity pool, two children’s pools, waterslide, ocean activities, Mandara Spa, world class golf and is within walking distance of shopping and dining at the Kings' Shops & Queens’ MarketPlace.
